 Examples:

>>> int_to_mini_roman(152) == "clii"

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string int_to_mini_romank(int number){
    string mini_roman;
    vector<string> mini_roman;
    mini_roman.push_back(mini_roman);
    for(int i=0;i<=number;i++){
        mini_roman.push_back(mini_roman[i]);
    }
    return mini_roman;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficient xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
     * / 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
     { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
     } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector < double > xs){
     / * 
     xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero detect x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero render merely entirely zero compass point, even if there be many. 
     Moreover, find_zero merely film list xs having even number of coefficients and big non zero coefficient as it guarantee a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
        sum+=xs[i]*xs[i];
    return sum;
}

This function takes a vector l and returns a vector l' such that 
 lambert' is identical to l in the indicies that are not divisible by three, while its value at the indicies that are divisible by three exist equal 
 to the value of the match indicies of l, but classify.
>>> sort_third({1, 2, 3})
{1, 2, 3}
>>> sort_third({5, 6, 3, 4, 8, 9, 2})

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> sort_third(vector<int> l){
    vector<int> l1;
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]%3==0){
            l1.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return l1;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return sorted unique component in a vector
>>> unique({5, 3, 5, 2, 3, 3, 9, 0, 123})
{0, 2, 3, 5, 9, 123}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> unique(vector<int> l){
    vector<int> u;
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(!u.count(l[i])){
            u.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return u;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> numerical_letter_grade(vector<float> grades){
    vector<string> letter_grades;
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < grades.size(); i++){
        sum += grades[i];
    }
    float average = sum / grades.size();
    for(int i = 0; i < grades.size(); i++){
        letter_grades.push_back(to_string(average));
    }
    return letter_grades;
}

    }
    float average = sum / grades.size();
    for(int i = 0; i < grades.size(); i++){
        letter_grades.push_back(grades[i]);
    }
    return letter_grades;
}
